_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The qualities of a mendicant whose mind: Truly seeing any kind of form with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of feeling with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of perception with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of choices with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of consciousness with right understanding
The qualities of a mendicant who is a pe: Truly seeing any kind of form with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of feeling with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of perception with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of choices with right understanding
Truly seeing any kind of consciousness with right understanding
Having done what had to be done
Having achieved their own true goal
Having utterly ended the fetters of rebirth
The things that come from giving to a re: Whatever comes from giving to a recipient of a religious donation such as yourself—who is not free of greed, hate, and delusion—will accrue to the donors.
Whatever comes from giving to a recipient of a religious donation such as myself—who is free of greed, hate, and delusion—will accrue to you.
